children.text: The waterproofing does not extend up the walls at least 25mm above the proposed finished floor level.
The relevant Australian Standard AS 3740 – Waterproofing of domestic wet areas states in section 3.9.1 Perimeter flashing that
‘Perimeter flashing to wall/floor surfaces shall be continuously sealed to the horizontal surface and have a vertical leg of a minimum of
25 mm above the finished floor level ’ .
The builder must rectify the wall/floor junctions to all of the wet areas of this home as required by the NCC/BCA and the relevant Australian Standard AS 3740.
